intro: Oxytria albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered oxytria, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
